metadata.documentation: Multi-Source Weighted-Ensemble Precipitation (MSWEP) is a global precipitation dataset for the period 1979–2015 with a 3-hourly temporal and 0.25° spatial resolution, designed for hydrological modeling and built by optimally merging several quality controlled data sources (CHPclim, CPC Unified, GPCC, CMORPH, GSMaP-MVK, TMPA 3B42RT, ERA-Interim and JRA-55). MSWEP is available via http://www.gloh2o.org/.
Data linked from the National Computational Infrastructure THREDDS Server via the OPeNDAP sevice.
Dataset included in the User Data Gateway (UDG, http://www.meteo.unican.es/udg-wiki) maintained by the Santander MetGroup. Register and accept the data policy to access to this dataset.

Beck, H.E., A.I.J.M. van Dijk, V. Levizzani, J. Schellekens, D.G. Miralles, B. Martens, A. de Roo (2016): MSWEP: 3-hourly 0.25° global gridded precipitation (1979–2015) by merging gauge, satellite, and reanalysis data, Hydrology and Earth System Sciences Discussions, doi:10.5194/hess-2016–236.
